intro: Thysanotus prolifer, commonly known as the everlastings or star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its small, star-shaped blue or violet flowers. The plant is typically found in rocky soils and has a compact, bushy growth habit. It produces numerous small, fibrous roots and is often cultivated for its ornamental value. Thysanotus prolifer is also noted for its ability to thrive in coastal environments.
